result.execSummary:
The defendant Schivon B Young was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Use Shielding Device (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 09-01-2015 or alternate of 10 days Jail. Defendant given 1 day Credit towards the alternate, if fine is not paid.
Surcharges to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 09-01-2015 or alternate of 10 days Jail.

records.addlTxt: Judgment of Conviction signed and filed

Defendant Schivon B Young in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a no contest plea as to count 3 and count 2 is dismissed and read-in.  Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine and DNA surcharge of $589.00 plus the $10.00 DRGOD surchage for a total of $589.00
Defendant given 1 day credit towards the alternate, if fine is not paid. 
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month commencing 09/01/2015 or alternate of 10 days jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers in court.   Defendant Schivon B Young did not appear.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Schivon B Young in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Schivon B Young in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is eligible for PD appointment.  
Defendant would like to proceed without counsel and accept the State's offer.  
Court notes it will not have time to proceed today with plea and sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Schivon B Young in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and return at 1:30.  Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant to have no contact with any co-actors or the business listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Schivon B Young in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Defendant would like to accept the state's pre-trial offer. 
  Hearing scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
